title: Article 52 Provision
simplifiedText: Article 52 is an important constitutional provision under Part V of the Indian Constitution. It deals with matters related to the Executive branch at the Union level of government. This article helps define powers, responsibilities, structure, and functioning of the executive so that governance remains structured, accountable, and constitutionally valid. It ensures that the balance of power and rule of law are maintained within the Indian democratic framework.
example: For example, if an issue arises concerning the functioning, powers, appointment, removal, or responsibilities of authorities under the executive branch at the union level, Article 52 provides the constitutional guidance. Courts, government officials, and lawmakers may refer to this article when interpreting constitutional procedures or resolving disputes.
funFact: Fun Fact: Article 52 contributes to the foundational structure of India's constitutional democracy. Many such provisions were inspired by constitutional systems like the UK, USA, Ireland, and Canada, but adapted to suit India's federal and parliamentary system.

This article helps define powers, responsibilities, structure, and functioning of the judiciary so that governance remains structured, accountable, and constitutionally valid. It ensures that the balance of power and rule of law are maintained within the Indian democratic framework.
example: For example, if an issue arises concerning the functioning, powers, appointment, removal, or responsibilities of authorities under the judiciary branch at the union level, Article 130 provides the constitutional guidance. Courts, government officials, and lawmakers may refer to this article when interpreting constitutional procedures or resolving disputes.
funFact: Fun Fact: Article 130 contributes to the foundational structure of India's constitutional democracy. Many such provisions were inspired by constitutional systems like the UK, USA, Ireland, and Canada, but adapted to suit India's federal and parliamentary system.
